questions.title: User-created optional files
questions.body:
ZeroMe allowes you to post images as optional files. How can I add a similar functionality to my zite? The steps I would imagine are: 
- Add a optional-Regex which matches the file to the users's content.json
- Let the user select a file with the file input HTML element
- Copy the file somehow to the user's subfolder
- Sign and publish the content.json

But how do you copy the file? I tried reading ZeroMe's code but imo CoffeeScript is unreadable.

answers.body: Are you trying to sign the zite's root content.json with your ZeroID certificate? To sign this content.json you need the zite's private key instead.

Found the solution: You need to use the [HTML5 File API to read the file](https://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/file/dndfiles/), encode it in Base64 and then use the ZeroNet fileWrite API to store it.
